intro: Euteline, commonly known as the common euteline, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Euteline is native to various regions in Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
